getAutoAddServers

public boolean getAutoAddServers()
Returns whether Splunk automatically discovers other servers.

Returns:
whether Splunk automatically discovers other servers.

getBlacklistNames

public java.lang.String getBlacklistNames()
Returns a comma separated list of server names that are excluded from being peers, or null if not available.

Returns:
servers, by name, that are excluded from being peers.

getBlacklistUrls

public java.lang.String getBlacklistUrls()
Returns a comma separated list of server URLs that are excluded from being peers. URLs are in the form x.x.x.x:port, or null if not available.

Returns:
servers, by URL, that are excluded from being peers.

getConnectionTimeout

public int getConnectionTimeout()
Return connection timeout in seconds, or -1 if not specified.

Returns:
The connection timeout in seconds.

getCheckTimedOutServersFrequency

public int getCheckTimedOutServersFrequency()
Returns the number of seconds between checking servers that are already timed-out. Zero means do not recheck. The default is sixty seconds. If removeTimedOutServers is false the setting has no effect.

Returns:
The number of seconds to check timed-out servers.

getHeartbeatFrequency

public int getHeartbeatFrequency()
Returns the number of seconds between checking on other servers health. If set to zero, heartbeat checks are disabled.

Returns:
The number of seconds between checking on other servers health.

getHeartbeatMcastAddress

public java.lang.String getHeartbeatMcastAddress()
Returns the multi-cast address to discover other servers and receive heartbeats, or null if not available.

Returns:
The multi-cast address for discovery and heartbeat messages.

getHeartbeatPort

public int getHeartbeatPort()
Returns the port used for heartbeat messages.

Returns:
The heatbeat port.

getReceiveTimeout

public int getReceiveTimeout()
Returns receive timeout in seconds, or -1 if not specified.

Returns:
The receive timeout in seconds.

getRemovedTimedOutServers

public boolean getRemovedTimedOutServers()
Returns whether or not timed out servers are removed from the distributed configuration.

Returns:
whether ot not timed out servers are removed from the distributed configuration.

getServerTimeout

public int getServerTimeout()
Deprecated. Use specific connectionTimeout, receiveTimeout, sendTimeout. Returns the timeout in seconds, to determine a server timeout.

Returns:
The timeout in seconds, to determine a server timeout.

getSendTimeout

public int getSendTimeout()
Returns send timeout in seconds, or -1 if not specified.

Returns:
The send timeout in seconds.

getServers

public java.lang.String getServers()
Returns a comma separated list of peer servers, or null if not available.

Returns:
The list of peer servers.

getShareBundles

public boolean getShareBundles()
Returns whether or not this server uses bundle replication to share search time configuration with search peers. Note: if set to false, the search head assumes the search peers can access a bundles through shared storage (NAS).

Returns:
whether or not this server uses bundle replication.

getSkipOurselves

public boolean getSkipOurselves()
Returns whether or not this server participates in a search. If set to true, this server does NOT participate as a server in any search or other call. This is used for building a node that does nothing but merge the results from other servers.

Returns:
Whether or not this server participates in a search.

getStatusTimeout

public int getStatusTimeout()
Returns the number of seconds for connection timeouts when gathering a search peer's basic information.

Returns:
The number of seconds for connection timeout.

getTtl

public int getTtl()
Returns the time-to-live of heartbeat messages.

Returns:
The time-to-live of heartbeat messages.

isDistSearchEnabled

public boolean isDistSearchEnabled()
Returns whether or not distributed search is enabled.

Returns:
If distributed search is enabled or disabled.
